# This Python 3 environment comes with many helpful analytics libraries installed
# It is defined by the kaggle/python Docker image: https://github.com/kaggle/docker-python

import numpy as np # linear algebra
import pandas as pd # data processing, CSV file I/O (e.g. pd.read_csv)
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import seaborn as sns

# Input data files are available in the read-only "../input/" directory
# For example, running this (by clicking run or pressing Shift+Enter) will list all files under the input directory

import os
for dirname, _, filenames in os.walk('/kaggle/input'):
    for filename in filenames:
        print(os.path.join(dirname, filename))

# You can write up to 20GB to the current directory (/kaggle/working/) that gets preserved as output when you create a version using "Save & Run All" 
# You can also write temporary files to /kaggle/temp/, but they won't be saved outside of the current session
source.6617e4b6:
data['director'].replace(np.nan,"Raúl Campos, Jan Suter" ,inplace  = True)
data['cast'].replace(np.nan,"David Attenborough" ,inplace  = True)
data['country'].replace(np.nan,"United States" ,inplace  = True)
data['date_added'].replace(np.nan,"January 1, 2020" ,inplace  = True)
data['rating'].replace(np.nan,"TV-MA" ,inplace  = True)
source.7e40ed5b:
#after replacling the nan value with most top rated value chack the null values again
data.isnull().sum()
source.df9be474:
#Top 13 Countries for Movies and TV Shows
plt.figure(figsize=(12,10))
sns.set(style="darkgrid")
ax = sns.countplot(x="country", data=data,order=data['country'].value_counts().index[0:13])
source.8f608d5d:
#Top 20 Countries for Movies and TV Shows
fig,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(12,6))
sns.countplot(y=data.country,order=data.country.value_counts().index[0:20])
plt.title("Top 15 Countries for Movies and TV Shows")
plt.xlabel("Number of Titles")
plt.ylabel("Country")
plt.show()
source.640a16f1:
#Top 15 director name for Movies and TV Shows
fig,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(12,6))
sns.countplot(y=data.director,order=data.director.value_counts().index[0:15],palette="Set2")
plt.title("Top 15 director name for Movies and TV Shows")
plt.xlabel("Number of Titles")
plt.ylabel("Country")
plt.show()

#top 15 date_added name for Movies and TV Shows
fig,ax=plt.subplots(figsize=(12,6))
sns.countplot(y=data.date_added,order=data.date_added.value_counts().index[0:15],palette="Set2")
plt.title("Top 15 date_added name for Movies and TV Shows")
plt.xlabel("Number of Titles")
plt.ylabel("Country")
plt.show()
